channel.title: Fletcher Kelly | Cloud Engineer
channel.description: Recent content on Fletcher Kelly | Cloud Engineer

item.title: Azure Resource Graph - More queries for Networking and Management Groups
item.description: Just some more queries I have developed. Networking Don’t create unnecessarily large virtual networks (for example, /16) to ensure that IP address space isn’t wasted.

item.title: Azure Resource Group Enterprise Scale Landing Zone queries
item.description: This is just a quick post. I am slowly working on building a collection of Resource Graph Queries - they can be found here and will grow over time.

item.title: Bicep Troubleshooting
item.description: Some basic “troubleshooting” with Azure Bicep So, let me start with this. The team and the community behind Azure Bicep are amazing.

item.title: Azure CLI - List Locations and Peers
item.description: How to use the Azure CLI to list Azure Locations and their peers So this will be a “quick post” that shows some great functionality within the Azure CLI with az account list-locations.

item.title: Azure Rest Api Postman Basics
item.description: Absolute basics with Azure and PostMan Getting started Many of the articles I have found online with regards to the Azure REST API assume a fair level of familiarity with Azure which can be a good and bad thing.

item.title: Expiring Keys and Secrets within Azure Key Vault
item.description: I was working with a customer the other day and a fairly simple ask came up, I however could not find an immediate answer within the portal.

item.title: My New Blog Home with Azure Static Web App
item.description: So, I have spent the last few days / weeks deciding the best way to host a blog.

item.title: Azure Ghost CMS and Azure CDN
item.description: I moved my blog onto HUGO. Not everyone would want to do this necessarily, there is a bit of a learning curve, part of the reason I DID IT :).

item.title: Importance of Networking Azure
item.description: As a start to this blog post, I think it is important to understand how I see my role as a CSA (Cloud Solution Architect) with my customer.

item.title: Cloud Solutions Architect - Tools of the Trade
item.description: So a question I often get asked is “what tools or products do you use?”. So I decided to do a post around the tools and technologies that I personally use on a daily basis.

item.title: Network Security Group Change Alerting
item.description: So, I was with a customer and they are asking for a fairly standard alert.

item.title: SLA Reporting with PowerShell and SCSM
item.description: I always get asked about reporting from my customers, and specifically around SLA’s. SLA’s are very important to most companies as this is part of the tracking mechanism of employees and vendors and the like.

item.title: Grey Agent Fixing with Orchestrator
item.description: So, here is the scenario, we managed a lot of customer’s System Centre Operations Manager (SCOM) environments.

item.title: Deploy a VM – SCSM, SCVMM, SCORCH – all working in harmony
item.description: So, it has been a while. So, the requirement for this project was as follow.

item.title: Cireson Outlook Console
item.description: So, Cireson hase been investing into System Centre Service Manager (SCSM) very heavily and the end results are WELL worth it.

item.title: Adding Comments to Work Items with Orchestrator
item.description: Hi All, It has been a little while, i have been quite involved with an Integration Project.

item.title: Send Email to 3rd Party from SCSM Console – PowerShell and Console Task
item.description: So recently, I had a customer ask me for the following as their previous incident management system had this functionality.

item.title: Finding off site ready tapes for System Center Data Protection Manager with System Center Orchestrator
item.description: So, I am quite a keen user of PowerShell and System Centre Orchestrator. Ok, so I recently had a request from a customer that went as follows “I need DPM to alert me when tapes are ready to “be taken off-site”.

item.title: Backup Network Configuration with PowerShell
item.description: So, one of the consultants in the company I work at came to me with a strange request.

item.title: Service Request Load Testing for SCSM
item.description: I have found a great for load testing SCSM with Incidents and copy here. The script uses SMLets to generate Incidents and you can then gauge how your system would handle the load you are planning within your Production Environment.

item.title: New features–Cireson IT Asset Management
item.description: I have previously done a post on Cireson IT Asset Management. However the people at Cireson have been very busy with new features to be added to their ITAM (IT Asset Management) tool.

item.title: End User Portal for System Centre Orchestrator
item.description: So, let’s ay you have invested the time and gotten System Centre Orchestrator up and running in your environment and you have the product performing some day to day tasks and it is working well.

item.title: Cireson IT Asset Management with Service Manager
item.description: Cireson have recently released an new enhancement to the System Centre Service Manager console called the Cireson SCSM Asset Management App.

item.title: Import CI Items with Cireson Asset Import Tool
item.description: With my previous post about importing data, I showed you how to use the built-in CSV connector to do this task and how to create the required Projection Classes.

item.title: Importing data into Service Manager–CSV import and XML
item.description: So, just recently I was asked by a customer to import data from an “old” SCSM system.

item.title: Cireson Risk Calculator
item.description: When looking at Change Management, usually the most difficult to decide on, is the “Severity” or “Impact” of the Change.

item.title: Cubes Missing from Data Warehouse and throwing error from within the SCSM Console
item.description: So, just the other day I opened the SCSM console to look at the cubes and process as needed, since some new reports needed to be built and Excel spread sheets created by our BI person for business.

item.title: Cireson My Active Work Items
item.description: So, Cireson has been hard at work to fill a few gaps present within the Service Manager space.

item.title: Recover System Center Orchestrator 2012 with runbooks export
item.description: Just recently in a test environment, a script or some such other gremlin caused some absolute havoc on my system.

item.title: Cireson Analyst Web Console
item.description: I have always heard complaints from some of the analysts in my company about having to install the Service Manager Console on their machines and then complaining about having to learn a new application.

item.title: Group assignment with Service Manager
item.description: So one of the biggest issues I have with Service Manager is actually user based as seems to be quite difficult to teach the concept of this for some strange reason.

item.title: AssignedTo and AffectedUser with Powershell – Service Manager
item.description: “I am trying to find a way to find all Incidents related to a specific person (assigned to or affected user) using PowerShell”

item.title: Exchange Log File Monitoring Orchestration
item.description: So what started this is actually quite simple. We have limited space on our virtual machines and the log files for IIS keeping filling up the drive on our Hub Transport Server (Exchange Server 2010).

item.title: Auto-Closing work items made easy–Service Manager 2012
item.description: So, there are a few ways of tackling the issue of automatically closing Incidents/Change Requests within Service Manager.

item.title: ConfigMgr (SCCM) 2012 wont open console–cannot connect to the site
item.description: So, we have started our migration from ConfigMgr 2007 R2 to SCCM 2012. We have installed the new site and now we have started building the required collections as we are using a mix of old collections from ConfigMgr 2007 ( a lot of the built-in collections that are present in ConfigMgr 2007 are NOT present in SCCM 2012.

item.title: Inactive Incidents–E-mail assigned to User
item.description: Just recently I was looking for a way to notify users about Inactive incidents as I have some departments that tend to ignore their work items and an e-mail about their “untouched” incidents seems to motivate them.

item.title: Exchange Connector – SCSM 2012
item.description: So, I decided to extend the functionality of Service Manager even more with the Exchange Connector.

item.title: My Windows Server 2012 Journey
item.description: So, my journey with Windows Server 2012 has started. The primary focus of my company’s journey is Hyper-V3.

item.title: Networking issues with Hyper-V
item.description: Just recently I was running into some very strange issues with my Hyper-V Cluster. we have numerous NICs to allow for redundancy and better throughput for our clustered environment.

item.title: DPM and Exchange Mail Store Backup failing
Service Requests – Re-assignment notification
item.description: So, in an effort to get my business ready for Service Requests as we use mainly Incidents and we are beginning our journey into Service Requests and differentiating between Service Requests (day to day operations) and Incidents (something is broken), I needed to reproduce a workflow to notify the “AssignedToUser” when a new Service Request is assigned to him or her.

item.title: Why is my Service Manager so slow?
item.description: So, I have been running Service Manager for quite some time now. From SCSM 2010 to SCSM SP1 and most of the CU’s before I upgraded to SCSM 2012 Beta and RC and then to RTM (with the help of a Microsoft TAP Program).

item.title: Installing System Centre Orchestrator
item.description: So, just recently I decided to install System Centre Orchestrator. It appears easy enough if you follow the Technet articles.

item.title: Basic Cluster Troubleshooting
item.description: So, just last night, we had an issue with our cluster.One of our disks would not come online.

item.title: OpsMan 2007 R2–Collation, Collation, Collation!!!!!!
item.description: So, recently I decided to take the plunge and upgrade to SCOM 2012. So, there were a few pre-requisites that I needed as per the prereq checker that is built into OpsMan 2012.

item.title: Upgrading from SCSM 2010 / SCSM 2012 PRE-RTM to SCSM 2012 RTM
item.description: So, You are now ready to take the plunge and upgrade to SCSM 2012 RTM as it now “publically” available.

item.title: Service Manager–Are my changes to management packs taking effect?
item.description: Okay, So now onto some “basics” or nice to know about Service Manager. Some of these I have learnt the hard way and some have been given to me as valuable information to avoid some mishaps if you will.

item.title: Adding a CSV volume to a Cluster
item.description: So, now you are at the point where you need to present a CSV Volume to your cluster.

item.title: Powershell Transcript logging
item.description: I have recently started keeping a track of all my PowerShell. Just a nice simple update.

item.title: Testing Domain Controller Connectivity (using PowerShell)
item.description: I believe that the best way to improve your skill is to test and push yourself.

item.title: Rebuilding the OpsMan Client Cache
item.description: Just recently I had the need to “rebuild” the client cache on a lot of my servers, due to a slight hiccup with our Network and subsequently our Operations Manager Server.

item.title: System Centre Service Manager 2012 Portal
item.description: So now, I move onto the final part of the SCSM 2012 journey, the Portal.

item.title: Service Manager 2012 Management Server (Upgrade)
item.description: So, for the Management Server. This was very easy and quite painless for me. Backup Encryption Key (for Disaster Recovery Purposes) Install Windows Server 2008 R2 SP1 (This is a pre-requisite for SCSM 2012) Remove Operations Manager Agent if this is installed, as the installer WILL stop you from continuing if the OpsMan Agent is installed.

item.title: Service Manager 2012 Data Warehouse (Upgrade)
item.description: So, my journey with System Centre Service Manager 2012 Beta has begun and so far I have indeed found some funnies.

item.title: Building a Pre-Production environment for Service Manager 2010
item.description: I can now post this, as my steps have been published on the SCSM Team Engineering site here.

item.title: Scheduled reports with SCSM Data Warehouse
item.description: Hi All, I know it has been a little while. The reports built into Service Manager are great, however when you try to get a bit creative and automate some of the reports, you are going to run into some issues.

item.title: Monitoring the Environment
item.description: So, a little while ago I had a post about documenting the environment. Now, i am in the process of “Monitoring the Environment”.

item.title: Documenting the Environment
item.description: Hi All, It has been a really busy time for me. However, I am very happy with life at the moment.

item.title: Microsoft Word, SharePoint, a Form and NO InfoPath on Server
item.description: So, just recently I was asked to work yet another miracle. The Scope. We need to go paperless.

item.title: Some more SMlets commands (more detail)
item.description: Would you like a nice graphical breakdown of all calls logged in (x) days and there status?

item.title: Get-hotfix on Steroids
item.description: Hi All, I have taken the get-hotfix and tweaked it so something useful for my environment.

item.title: Building more redundancy and replicating folder structure
item.description: We have had a few failures of the power kind (thanks to the electricity provider in South Africa, who will remain nameless).

item.title: DPM and Invoke-Command, bring the DPM shell to your machine
item.description: Not that long ago, I created an article about DPM and I referenced DPM commands to be run in the DPM shell and only now realised that not everyone has the DPM console installed as this is not the easiest console to install and get working.

item.title: Exchange(ing) e-mail
item.description: So, it has been another week and as always something new has been learnt. This time, however the product in question was Exchange Server 2010.

item.title: Changing your Protection Server in DPM to another server
item.description: Have you ever been in a situation where you have either removed or added a new DPM server to your environment?

item.title: To Protect or NOT to Protect
item.description: I have finally found some time to look some more into DPM and decided to modify my environment and created some additional PROTECTION GROUPS.

item.title: POWERshell console to power all plugins
item.description: I do not know about everyone else. I am a rather busy admin and quite fond of powershell and scripting.

item.title: Using SMLets practically
item.description: In my previous post, SCSM And Powershell, I mentioned that I am now starting to play with get-scsmobject.

item.title: SCSM and Powershell
item.description: Hi all, i have been playing with SMLets3 and get-scsmobject and using information from the post by Travis Wright, Using SMLets Beta 3 Post #1 – Using Get-SCSMObject, Get-SCSMClass to Dump Data from SCSM.

item.title: The “crisis” week
item.description: Hi All, The last two weeks have been a little nutty for me. I have however, learnt to appreciate a few more things in life.

item.title: Some more trick and things I have learnt with Service Manager 2010 SP1
item.description: When creating a new Self Service portal, ensure that you log onto on the server using your “Service Manager” Account, the account configured when first creating the Service Manager Server.

item.title: Service Manager 2010 SP1 Custom Portal
item.description: It has been a little bit of a busy while for me. However, I finally found the time to complete the Custom Service Manager Portal, I have not as yet implemented custom graphics.

item.title: The joys of DPM and the pains of SQL
item.description: Just recently, as in the weekend just gone, I had a change for an upgrade of SQL 2008 to SQL 2008 R2.

item.title: Service Manager and all the tricks I have learnt
item.description: It has been some time since I last blogged, been a really nutty time. however i will make the time to blog and hopefully who ever reads this, it will be of assistance to them.

item.description: I decided to yet again sue Bitlocker, even knowing the previous experencies i have with it.

item.description: Do you ever have those days where it just starts bad and gets worse? “Man Alive, what a day it has been and it is not over yet”
